Regiments can be light artillery, cavalry, or infantry. Company letters do not overlap with these splits i.e. if the soldiers are both in the 2nd U.S.C.T. Regiment, Company A; both soldiers were either infantry, cavalry, or light artillery.
The 2nd regiment petitions documented are from the 2nd Infantry regiment. Most regiments are organized by strategy: artillery, cavalry and infantry. Infantry regiments are typically foot soldiers, cavalry regiments are soldiers on horseback, and artillery regiments are armed soldiers who travel with heavy artillery.
54 of the 59 petitions are from widows of privates. Privates are the lowest rank of enlisted soldiers in the army who make up a company. Companies are led by corporals of which there are 4 widows’ claims in this project. One widow featured was married to a sergeant, and another to a military musician.
